tourism.title: Theme Park Development – Nuwara Eliya
tourism.subTitle: Sri Lanka’s Next Iconic Hill-Country Leisure Destination
tourism.description: A US$75 million world-class theme park with an 80-room boutique hotel developed in three phases to create a premium hill-country attraction.

tourism.title: Diyawanna Frolic Island Recreational Hub
tourism.subTitle: Sri Lanka’s Next Iconic Urban Leisure Asset
tourism.description: A USD 115 million integrated leisure hub in Battaramulla spanning 27.3 acres of waterfront land.

tourism.title: Majestic Kandy Hotel Development
tourism.subTitle: A Landmark Hospitality Investment in Sri Lanka’s Cultural Capital
tourism.description: A USD 75 million heritage-compliant 5-star hotel development located in central Kandy on a 3-acre prime leasehold. The project features 85 luxury keys including Deluxe Rooms, Heritage Suites, Pool Villas, and Presidential Residences within a two-storey pavilion design respecting sacred height limits. Positioned in Sri Lanka’s UNESCO cultural capital, the project offers a protected luxury hospitality asset under a 99-year lease structure.
keyHighlights: 85 luxury keys including suites, villas and presidential residences
Two-storey pavilion design respecting sacred height regulations
Located in UNESCO World Heritage tourism hub
Full BOI investment incentives & fiscal concessions
100% foreign ownership permitted with full repatriation of capital & profits

tourism.title: Sri Lanka Cruise Line Development
tourism.subTitle: Asia’s Central Hub for Cruise Tourism Growth
tourism.description: A USD 70 million investment opportunity to launch a world-class cruise line operating around Sri Lanka, linking Colombo, Galle, Trincomalee, and Jaffna (Kankesanthurai Port). The project captures the spirit of island luxury and maritime adventure, leveraging BOI incentives and rising inbound tourism to generate sustainable growth and long-term investor returns.
keyHighlights: Fleet deployment and onboard hospitality ecosystem
Asia’s emerging cruise tourism hub positioning
Fare revenue + onboard ancillary revenue streams
6-year tax holiday under Strategic Development Project status
Full repatriation of capital and profits

tourism.title: Cinema City – Integrated Film & Studio Tourism Hub
tourism.subTitle: Sri Lanka’s Next Global Creative Economy Anchor
tourism.description: A USD 119 million investment to develop Asia’s integrated film production and studio tourism hub spanning 406 acres under a 30-year BOI lease. Positioned to serve rapidly expanding OTT and film markets, the project combines cost-efficient production infrastructure, diversified tourism revenue streams, and BOI-backed incentives to deliver stable long-term returns.
keyHighlights: Asia’s integrated film & studio tourism hub
Core production infrastructure and studio facilities
8-year tax holiday under Strategic Development Project status
Full repatriation of capital and profits

urban.title: Makumbura Mixed-Use Commercial Development – Kottawa
urban.subTitle: A Modern Office & Commercial Hub at Makumbura
urban.description: A USD 18 million BOI-facilitated mixed-use commercial development located on a prime 1.18-acre UDA-owned land parcel in Makumbura, Kottawa. The project integrates Grade-A office space, retail, co-working facilities, and commuter-focused services to capture high-growth suburban commercial demand with diversified revenue streams.
keyHighlights: Prime location 2 km from Makumbura Multimodal Transport Center
Diversified revenue from office, retail, co-working & parking
Strong suburban office demand driven by Colombo decentralisation

urban.title: Madola Eco-Resort & Residential Mixed Development
urban.subTitle: Sustainable Eco-Tourism & Lifestyle Investment in Avissawella
urban.description: A USD 15 million BOI-facilitated eco-resort and residential mixed development located on 12.9 acres of UDA-owned land in Madola, Avissawella. The project integrates 22 premium eco-villas and 18 residential bungalows within a low-density, environmentally sensitive master plan.
keyHighlights: Low-density sustainable master plan (25–30% land coverage)
Diversified revenue from tourism, residential sales & wellness
100% foreign ownership with full profit repatriation
Strong eco-tourism growth and ESG-aligned investment

ict.title: Techno Parks – Kurunegala & Galle
ict.subTitle: Invest in Sri Lanka’s Emerging Technology Capital
ict.description: A USD 100 million development of regional innovation parks with digital infrastructure and export-oriented IT services.

education.title: University Town – Sooriyawewa
education.subTitle: Sri Lanka’s First Integrated University Town
education.description: A USD 640 million international university ecosystem on 250 acres in Hambantota.

education.title: Keragala University Town
education.subTitle: Five-University Master Planned Campus
education.description: A USD 370 million 125-acre education campus designed to host five leading universities.

transport.title: Logistics & Freight Forwarding – Mattala Airport
transport.subTitle: Sri Lanka’s Next Strategic Logistics Frontier
transport.description: A 101.3-acre aviation-linked logistics hub integrating warehousing and multimodal connectivity.

aviation.title: West Container Terminal II – Colombo Port
aviation.subTitle: Expanding Global Maritime Connectivity
aviation.description: A USD 750 million PPP expansion of Colombo Port adding 3 million TEUs capacity.

manufacturing.title: Sustainable Synthetic Textile Hub – Eravur
manufacturing.subTitle: Integrated Textile Manufacturing Platform
manufacturing.description: A USD 65 million integrated synthetic textile hub in the Eravur Textile Zone.

manufacturing.title: EV Assembling Hub – Mirijjawila
manufacturing.subTitle: South Asia’s Gateway to EV Assembly
manufacturing.description: A USD 300 million per plant EV assembly facility with 25,000 unit annual capacity.

renewable.title: Pumped Storage Power Plant (PSPP)
renewable.subTitle: Powering Sri Lanka’s Renewable Future
renewable.description: A USD 700 million utility-scale pumped storage project commencing 2029.

renewable.title: Natural Gas Fired ICE Power Plant
renewable.subTitle: Driving Returns Through Clean Energy
renewable.description: A 200 MW natural gas-fired power plant commencing 2026.

renewable.title: Natural Gas Fired Aero-Derivative Gas Turbines
renewable.subTitle: Energizing Tomorrow, Delivering Strong Returns
renewable.description: A 130 MW high-efficiency gas turbine project commencing 2028.
